column1: S0136.CARD.  1. CARD ONE
S0136.DECK.  136. SURVEY NUMBER
S0136.BALLOT.  X. BALLOT NUMBER GENERATED BY ROPER CENTER.
S0136.Q1. WHAT KIND OF A SQUADRON ARE YOU I?  1. SERVICE SQUADRON IN A FIGHTER OR BOMBER GROUP 2. FIGHTER SQUADRON 3. BOMBER SQUADRON 4. SOME OTHER TYPE OF OUTFIT 0. NO ANSWER
S0136.Q2. WHAT TYPE OF JOB DO YOU HAVE AT PRESEN?  1. COMBAT FLYING JOB 2. GROUND CREW - "LINE" JOB WORKING ON PLANES 3. OTHER GROUND JOB 0. NO ANSWER
S0136.V3. TYPE OF PERSONNEL TO QUESTION 3A:  1. COMBAT PERSONNEL 2. NON-COMBAT PERSONNEL

S0136.Q3A. IF YOU HAVE A COMBAT FLYING JOB, HOW MUCH COMBAT FLYING HAVE YOU DONE UP TO NO? (DO NOT COUNT PRACTICE MISSIONS OR ABORTIONS) E. NUMBER OF COMBAT MISSIONS COMPLETED:  ANP 01. 1 COMBAT MISSION COMPLETED . . . 99. 99 OR MORE MISSIONS COMPLETED 97.NONE 98.NO ANSWER 00.INAPPLICABLE (NON-COMBAT) E. NUMBER OF HOURS OF COMBAT FLYING:

S0136.Q3A. IF YOU HAVE A COMBAT FLYING JOB, HOW MUCH COMBAT FLYING HAVE YOU DONE UP TO NO? (DO NOT COUNT PRACTICE MISSIONS OR ABORTIONS) E. NUMBER OF COMBAT MISSIONS COMPLETED:  ANP 003. 3 HOURS OF COMBAT FLYING . . . 999. 999 HOURS OR MORE OF COMBAT FLYING 997.NONE 998.NO ANSWER 000.INAPPLICABLE (NON-COMBAT)

S0136.Q4. HOW IMPORTANT A PART DO YOU THINK YOUR TYPE OF OUTFIT WILL PLAY IN WINNING THE WAR AGAINST GERMAN?  1. VERY IMPORTANT 2. FAIRLY IMPORTANT 3. NOT VERY IMPORTANT 4. NOT IMPORTANT AT ALL 0. NO ANSWER

S0136.Q5. HOW IMPORTANT A PART DO YOU THINK YOUR TYPE OF OUTFIT WILL PLAY IN WINNING THE WAR AGAINST JAPA?  1. VERY IMPORTANT 2. FAIRLY IMPORTANT 3. NOT VERY IMPORTANT 4. NOT IMPORTANT AT ALL 0. NO ANSWER

S0136.Q6. IF YOU ARE IN EUROPEAN THEATER OPERATIONS WHEN GERMANY IS DEFEATED, DO YOU THINK YOU WILL BE NEEDED IN ANOTHER THEATER IN ORDER TO HELP BEAT JAPA?  1. YES, ALMOST IMMEDIATELY AFTER GERMANY'S DEFEAT 2. YES, BUT NOT UNTIL SOME TIME LATER 3. NO 4. HAVEN'T ANY IDEA 0. NO ANSWER

S0136.Q7. ABOUT HOW MUCH LONGER FROM NOW DO YOU THINK THE WAR WILL LAST WITH GERMAN?  1. LESS THAN 3 MONTHS FROM NOW 2. 3 TO 6 MONTHS FROM NOW 3. MORE THAN 6 MONTHS UP TO A YEAR FROM NOW 4. MORE THAN A YEAR UP TO 1 1/2 YEARS FROM NOW 5. MORE THAN 1 1/2 YEARS FROM NOW 0. NO ANSWER

S0136.Q8. AFTER GERMANY IS DEFEATED, ABOUT HOW MUCH LONGER DO YOU THINK THE WAR WILL LAST WITH JAPA?  1. LESS THAN 3 MONTHS FROM THE TIME GERMANY IS DEFEATED 2. 3 TO 6 MONTHS FROM THE TIME GERMANY IS DEFEATED 3. MORE THAN 6 MONTHS UP TO A YEAR FROM THE TIME GERMANY IS DEFEATED 4. MORE THAN A YEAR UP TO 1 1/2 YEARS FROM THE TIME GERMANY IS DEFEATED 5. MORE THAN 1 1/2 YEARS FROM THE TIME GERMANY IS DEFEATED 0. NO ANSWER

S0136.Q9. WHAT WOULD YOU LIKE TO SEE HAPPEN TO THE GERMANS AFTER THE WA?  1. PUNISH THE LEADERS, BUT NOT THE ORDINARY GERMANS 2. MAKE THE ORDINARY GERMAN PEOPLE SUFFER PLENTY 3. WIPE OUT THE WHOLE GERMAN NATION 4. NO ANSWER 0. NO CODE OR NO DATA

S0136.Q10. WHAT WOULD YOU LIKE TO SEE HAPPEN TO THE JAPANESE AFTER THE WA?  1. PUNISH THE LEADERS, BUT NOT THE ORDINARY JAPANESE 2. MAKE THE ORDINARY JAPANESE PEOPLE SUFFER PLENTY 3. WIPE OUT THE WHOLE JAPANESE NATION 0. NO ANSWER
S0136.Q11. ABOUT HOW LONG HAVE YOU BEEN OVERSEA?  1. LESS THAN 6 MONTHS 2. 6 MONTHS UP TO A YEAR 3. MORE THAN A YEAR, UP TO 1 1/2 YEARS 4. MORE THAN 1 1/2 YEARS 0. NO ANSWER
S0136.Q12. ARE YOU MARRIED OR SINGL?  1. MARRIED 2. SINGLE 3. WIDOWED, DIVORCED OR SEPARATED 0. NO ANSWER

S0136.Q13. HOW OLD WERE YOU ON YOUR LAST BIRTHDA?  01. 20 YEARS OR LESS 02. 21 YEARS 03. 22 04. 23 05. 24 06. 25 07. 26-29 YEARS 08. 30-34 YEARS 09. 35-37 YEARS 10. 38 YEARS 11. 39 YEARS AND OVER 00. NO ANSWER
S0136.Q14. ARE YOU AN OFFICER OR AN ENLISTED MA?  1. COMMISSIONED OFFICER 2. FLIGHT OFFICER OR WARRANT OFFICER 3. ENLISTED MAN 0. NO ANSWER
S0136.Q15. HOW DID YOU COME INTO THE ARM?  1. I WAS DRAFTED 2. I VOLUNTEERED 3. I WAS IN THE NATIONAL GUARD 4. I WAS A RESERVE OFFICER 0. NO ANSWER

S0136.Q16. IF YOU ARE IN EUROPEAN THEATER OPERATIONS WHEN GERMANY IS DEFEATED, HOW WOULD YOU FEEL ABOUT GOING TO ANOTHER THEATER TO HELP BEAT JAPA?  1. WOULD BE QUITE ANXIOUS TO GO 2. WOULD ONLY FEEL WILLING TO GO AFTER A FURLOUGH IN THE U.S. 3. WOULD RATHER GO AFTER A FURLOUGH IN THE U.S., BUT WOULD FEEL WILLING TO GO EVEN WITHOUT ONE IF IT SEEMED NECESSARY 4. WOULD NOT WANT TO GO AT ALL 0. NO ANSWER

S0136.Q17. IF YOU WERE SENT TO ANOTHER THEATER TO HELP DEFEAT JAPAN, WOULD YOU PREFER TO CONTINUE IN YOUR PRESENT TYPE OF JOB OR TO CHANGE TO SOME OTHER TYPE OF AIR CORPS JO?  1. WOULD PREFER TO KEEP MY PRESENT TYPE OF JOB 2. WOULD PREFER SOME OTHER TYPE - SPECIFIES SOME KIND OF COMBAT FLYING JOB 3. WOULD PREFER SOME OTHER TYPE - SPECIFIES OTHER NON-COMBAT FLYING JOB 4. WOULD PREFER SOME OTHER TYPE - NO ANSWER AS TO WHAT 5. IT WOULDN'T MAKE ANY DIFFERENCE TO ME 0. NO ANSWER

S0136.Q18. ALL THINGS CONSIDERED, WHERE DO YOU FEEL THAT YOU PERSONALLY COULD BE OF MOST VALUE TO THE TOTAL WAR EFFORT AT THE PRESENT TIM?  1. IN MY PRESENT ASSIGNMENT IN E.T.O. 2. IN SOME OTHER AIR CORPS ASSIGNMENT IN E.T.O. 3. IN AN AIR CORPS ASSIGNMENT IN ANOTHER THEATER IN THE FIGHT AGAINST JAPAN 4. SOMETHING ELSE 0. NO ANSWER

S0136.Q19A. WITH RESPECT TO THE DIFFICULTY OF COMBAT FLYIN?  1. MUCH TOUGHER IN THE PACIFIC THAN HERE 2. SOMEWHAT TOUGHER IN THE PACIFIC THAN HERE 3. ABOUT AS HARD ONE PLACE AS THE OTHER 4. SOMEWHAT EASIER IN THE PACIFIC THAN HERE 5. MUCH EASIER IN THE PACIFIC THAN HERE 6. NO OPINION 0. NO ANSWER

S0136.Q19B. WITH RESPECT TO THE GENERAL LIVING AND WORKING CONDITION?  1. MUCH BETTER IN THE PACIFIC THAN HERE 2. SOMEWHAT BETTER IN THE PACIFIC THAN HERE 3. ABOUT AS GOOD ONE PLACE AS THE OTHER 4. NOT QUITE AS GOOD IN THE PACIFIC AS HERE 5. NOT NEARLY AS GOOD IN THE PACIFIC AS HERE 6. NO OPINION 0. NO ANSWER

S0136.Q21. AFTER THE WAR, DO YOU THINK THE GERMANS SHOULD BE REQUIRED TO MAKE SOME TYPE OF PAYMENT FOR WHAT THE WAR HAS COST OTHER COUNTRIE?  1. THEY SHOULD PAY IN MONEY OR IN GOODS 2. THEY SHOULD PAY BY SENDING GERMAN LABORERS TO WORK IN ALLIED COUNTRIES WHICH NEED ADDITIONAL MAN-POWER TO REPAIR WAR DAMAGE 3. THEY SHOULD NOT BE REQUIRED TO PAY 4. UNDECIDED 5. NO ANSWER 0. NO CODE OR NO DATA

S0136.Q22. HOW ABOUT THE JAPANES?  1. THEY SHOULD PAY IN MONEY OR IN GOODS 2. THEY SHOULD PAY BY SENDING JAPANESE LABORERS TO WORK IN ALLIED COUNTRIES WHICH NEED ADDITIONAL MAN-POWER TO REPAIR WAR DAMAGE 3. THEY SHOULD NOT BE REQUIRED TO PAY 4. UNDECIDED 5. NO ANSWER 0. NO CODE OR NO DATA

TROOP CARRIERS 10. ENGINEERS (9TH)
S0136.V24. SERIAL NUMBER IDENTIFICATION:  ANP X. CODES NOT PROVIDED BY SURVEY ORGANIZATION. DATA TRANSFERRED AS IS.
